storyTitle: As Performance Manager, I want to configure review cycles to automate performance evaluations

testCases.title: Validate successful creation of review cycle
preconditions: User is logged in as Performance Manager
User has role-based access to Review Cycle Configuration
ReviewCycles table is accessible
API endpoint POST /api/reviewcycles is operational
At least one user or group exists in the system for assignment

steps.action: Navigate to Review Cycle Configuration page
steps.expectedResult: Page is displayed with existing cycles listed in a table format, showing cycle names, frequency, duration, and status

steps.action: Click 'Add Review Cycle' button
steps.expectedResult: Add Review Cycle form is displayed with empty fields for cycle name, frequency, duration, notification settings, and user/group assignment

steps.action: Enter valid cycle name (e.g., 'Q1 2024 Performance Review')
steps.expectedResult: Cycle name field accepts the input without validation errors

steps.action: Select frequency from dropdown (e.g., 'Quarterly')
steps.expectedResult: Frequency is selected and displayed in the field

steps.action: Enter valid duration value (e.g., '30 days')
steps.expectedResult: Duration field accepts the input without validation errors

steps.action: Configure notification settings by selecting notification schedule (e.g., '7 days before start', '1 day before end')
steps.expectedResult: Notification settings are configured and displayed correctly

steps.action: Assign review cycle to users or groups by selecting from available list
steps.expectedResult: Selected users or groups are added to the assignment list

steps.action: Click 'Submit' button to save the review cycle configuration
steps.expectedResult: System validates all inputs, saves the review cycle to ReviewCycles table, and displays success confirmation message with cycle details

steps.action: Verify the newly created review cycle appears in the list of configured cycles
steps.expectedResult: New review cycle is visible in the table with status 'Active' and all configured parameters displayed correctly

postconditions: Review cycle is saved in ReviewCycles table
Review cycle status is set to 'Active'
Assigned users or groups are linked to the review cycle
System is ready to process notifications based on configured schedule
API response time is under 2 seconds

testCases.title: Reject review cycle creation with invalid frequency
preconditions: User is logged in as Performance Manager
User has role-based access to Review Cycle Configuration
ReviewCycles table is accessible
API endpoint POST /api/reviewcycles is operational
Form validation rules are configured for frequency field

steps.action: Navigate to Review Cycle Configuration page
steps.expectedResult: Page is displayed with existing cycles and 'Add Review Cycle' button visible

steps.action: Click 'Add Review Cycle' button
steps.expectedResult: Add Review Cycle form is displayed with all required fields empty

steps.action: Enter valid cycle name (e.g., 'Invalid Frequency Test')
steps.expectedResult: Cycle name field accepts the input

steps.action: Enter invalid frequency value of zero (0) in the frequency field
steps.expectedResult: Validation error message is displayed: 'Frequency must be a positive value' or similar error text, field is highlighted in red

steps.action: Attempt to click 'Submit' button
steps.expectedResult: Submission is blocked, form does not submit, error message remains visible, focus returns to frequency field

steps.action: Clear frequency field and enter negative value (e.g., '-5')
steps.expectedResult: Validation error message is displayed: 'Frequency must be a positive value', field is highlighted in red

steps.action: Attempt to click 'Submit' button again
steps.expectedResult: Submission is blocked, form does not submit, error message remains visible

steps.action: Correct the frequency field by entering a valid positive value (e.g., '90 days')
steps.expectedResult: Validation error message disappears, field highlighting is removed, field shows valid state

steps.action: Complete remaining required fields with valid data and click 'Submit'
steps.expectedResult: Form is submitted successfully, review cycle is created, and confirmation message is displayed

postconditions: No review cycle is created with invalid frequency values
System maintains data integrity in ReviewCycles table
User is informed of validation requirements
Valid review cycle is created only after correction

storyTitle: As Performance Manager, I want to schedule review cycles for employees to ensure timely performance evaluations

testCases.title: Validate successful review cycle scheduling
preconditions: User is logged in as Performance Manager
User has role-based access to Review Cycle Scheduling
At least one review cycle template exists and is active
ReviewCycleSchedules table is accessible
API endpoint POST /api/reviewcycles/schedules is operational
Multiple employees or groups exist in the system for assignment
No existing scheduling conflicts for selected employees/groups

steps.action: Navigate to Review Cycle Scheduling page
steps.expectedResult: Page is displayed with available review cycle templates listed in a dropdown or selection list, showing template names and frequencies

steps.action: Select a review cycle template from the available templates (e.g., 'Q1 2024 Performance Review')
steps.expectedResult: Selected template is highlighted, template details (frequency, duration, notification settings) are displayed for reference

steps.action: Click on 'Select Employees/Groups' button or field
steps.expectedResult: Employee/Group selection interface is displayed with searchable list of available employees and groups

steps.action: Select multiple employees or groups from the list (e.g., 'Engineering Team', 'John Doe', 'Jane Smith')
steps.expectedResult: Selected employees and groups are added to the assignment list, count of selected items is displayed, selections are accepted without errors

steps.action: Enter valid start date in the start date field (e.g., '2024-04-01')
steps.expectedResult: Start date is accepted and displayed in correct format, date picker closes

steps.action: Enter valid end date in the end date field that is after start date (e.g., '2024-04-30')
steps.expectedResult: End date is accepted and displayed in correct format, no validation errors appear

steps.action: Review the scheduling summary showing template, assignees, and date range
steps.expectedResult: Summary displays all configured details accurately including template name, number of assignees, start date, and end date

steps.action: Click 'Submit' button to save the schedule
steps.expectedResult: System validates the schedule for conflicts, saves the schedule to ReviewCycleSchedules table, displays success confirmation message with schedule ID and details

steps.action: Verify the newly created schedule appears in the list of scheduled review cycles
steps.expectedResult: New schedule is visible in the scheduled cycles list with status 'Scheduled', showing template name, assignees count, start date, end date, and status

steps.action: Verify API response time
steps.expectedResult: System response time is under 2 seconds for the scheduling operation

postconditions: Review cycle schedule is saved in ReviewCycleSchedules table
Schedule status is set to 'Scheduled'
All selected employees and groups are linked to the schedule
Automated notifications are queued based on template settings
No scheduling conflicts exist
System is ready to track review completion

testCases.title: Reject scheduling with conflicting dates
preconditions: User is logged in as Performance Manager
User has role-based access to Review Cycle Scheduling
At least one review cycle template exists and is active
ReviewCycleSchedules table is accessible
An existing schedule already exists for specific employees/groups with defined date range (e.g., 'Engineering Team' scheduled from '2024-04-01' to '2024-04-30')
API endpoint POST /api/reviewcycles/schedules is operational
Date conflict validation is enabled

steps.action: Navigate to Review Cycle Scheduling page
steps.expectedResult: Page is displayed with available review cycle templates and existing schedules visible

steps.action: Select a review cycle template from available templates
steps.expectedResult: Template is selected and details are displayed

steps.action: Select the same employees or groups that have an existing schedule (e.g., 'Engineering Team')
steps.expectedResult: Employees/groups are selected and added to assignment list

steps.action: Enter start date that overlaps with existing schedule (e.g., '2024-04-15')
steps.expectedResult: Start date is entered in the field

steps.action: Enter end date that extends beyond existing schedule (e.g., '2024-05-15')
steps.expectedResult: End date is entered in the field

steps.action: Click 'Submit' button to attempt scheduling
steps.expectedResult: System detects scheduling conflict, displays validation error message: 'Scheduling conflict detected: Selected employees/groups already have a review cycle scheduled during this period' or similar, submission is blocked, conflicting schedule details are shown

steps.action: Review the conflict details displayed by the system
steps.expectedResult: Conflict information shows existing schedule dates, affected employees/groups, and existing template name

steps.action: Adjust start date to non-conflicting date after existing schedule ends (e.g., '2024-05-01')
steps.expectedResult: Start date is updated, validation error message disappears or updates to show no conflict

steps.action: Adjust end date to valid date after new start date (e.g., '2024-05-31')
steps.expectedResult: End date is updated, no validation errors are displayed

steps.action: Click 'Submit' button again with corrected dates
steps.expectedResult: System validates successfully with no conflicts, schedule is saved to ReviewCycleSchedules table, success confirmation message is displayed with schedule details

steps.action: Verify the newly created schedule appears in the list without conflicts
steps.expectedResult: New schedule is visible in the scheduled cycles list with status 'Scheduled', no conflict warnings are present

postconditions: No schedule is created with conflicting dates
System maintains scheduling integrity in ReviewCycleSchedules table
User is informed of specific conflict details
Valid schedule is created only after resolving conflicts
Both original and new schedules exist without overlap

storyTitle: As Performance Manager, I want to track the status of review cycles to monitor progress and completion

testCases.title: Validate accurate display of review cycle statuses
preconditions: User is logged in as Performance Manager with valid credentials
Multiple review cycles exist in the system with different statuses (scheduled, in-progress, completed, overdue)
User has role-based access permissions to view review cycle statuses
At least one review cycle is overdue to test alert functionality

steps.action: Navigate to Review Cycle Status page from the main dashboard or navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Review Cycle Status page loads successfully and displays a list of all review cycles with their respective statuses (scheduled, in-progress, completed, overdue)

steps.action: Verify that each review cycle in the list shows accurate status information including cycle name, status label, start date, end date, and assigned groups
steps.expectedResult: All review cycles display correct status information matching the actual state in the system. Status labels are clearly visible and color-coded appropriately

steps.action: Apply filter to show only 'In-Progress' review cycles using the status filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: List updates immediately to display only review cycles with 'In-Progress' status. Other statuses are filtered out

steps.action: Apply sorting by date in descending order using the date sort option
steps.expectedResult: List reorders to show review cycles with most recent dates at the top, maintaining the applied status filter

steps.action: Clear all filters and sort by status in ascending order
steps.expectedResult: All review cycles are displayed again, sorted alphabetically by status (completed, in-progress, overdue, scheduled)

steps.action: Observe the page for overdue review cycle alerts
steps.expectedResult: Alert notification is displayed prominently for overdue cycles, showing the cycle name, how many days overdue, and a visual indicator (icon or color)

steps.action: Trigger an overdue condition by waiting for a review cycle to pass its end date or manually adjusting system time (if test environment allows)
steps.expectedResult: System automatically updates the review cycle status to 'Overdue' and displays an alert notification within 1 minute of the condition being met

postconditions: Review cycle statuses remain accurately displayed
Applied filters and sorting preferences are maintained until cleared by user
Overdue alerts remain visible until acknowledged or resolved
System logs the user's access to review cycle status page

testCases.title: Verify detailed view of review cycle status
preconditions: User is logged in as Performance Manager with valid credentials
Review Cycle Status page is accessible and loaded
At least one review cycle exists in the system with complete information
User has permissions to view detailed review cycle information

steps.action: From the Review Cycle Status page, identify a review cycle from the list (preferably one with 'In-Progress' status)
steps.expectedResult: Review cycle is visible in the list with basic information displayed (name, status, dates)

steps.action: Click on the selected review cycle row or details link/button
steps.expectedResult: System navigates to the detailed view page for the selected review cycle

steps.action: Verify that the detailed view displays comprehensive status information including: cycle name, current status, start date, end date, assigned groups/departments, number of reviews completed, number of reviews pending, and overall progress percentage
steps.expectedResult: All detailed status information is displayed accurately and matches the data from the list view. Information is well-organized and easy to read

steps.action: Verify that the detailed view shows a breakdown of review statuses by individual reviewers or teams
steps.expectedResult: Detailed breakdown is visible showing which reviewers/teams have completed their reviews and which are pending

steps.action: Check for any additional information such as comments, notes, or history of status changes
steps.expectedResult: Additional contextual information is displayed if available, including audit trail of status changes with timestamps

steps.action: Navigate back to the Review Cycle Status list page using the back button or breadcrumb navigation
steps.expectedResult: System returns to the Review Cycle Status list page with previously applied filters and sorting maintained

postconditions: User remains on the Review Cycle Status page or detailed view as appropriate
No data is modified during the view operation
System logs the user's access to detailed review cycle information
Navigation history is preserved for easy return to previous views
